books.author: Freida McFadden
books.description: An advice columnist who is having trouble at work and home decides to get back at people she thinks deserve it.
books.title: DEAR DEBBIE

books.author: Allen Levi
books.description: A man travels to a small Southern town, where he purchases pencil drawings of local residents and exchanges them for stories.
books.title: THEO OF GOLDEN

books.author: Virginia Evans
books.description: Letters from someone she used to know push Sybil Van Antwerp toward revisiting her past and finding a way to forgive.
books.title: THE CORRESPONDENT

books.author: Rachel Reid
books.description: The second book in the Game Changers series. Rival captains of two hockey teams try to keep their relationship out of the spotlight.
books.title: HEATED RIVALRY

books.author: Douglas Preston and Lincoln Child
books.contributor: by Douglas Preston and Lincoln Child
books.description: Agent Pendergast’s ghastly first case involves a suspension and ritualistic killings.
books.title: PENDERGAST: THE BEGINNING

books.author: George Saunders
books.description: In the waning hours of an oil company chief executive’s life, worldly and otherworldly visitors put his time on Earth in perspective.
books.title: VIGIL

books.author: Freida McFadden
books.description: Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.
books.title: THE HOUSEMAID

books.author: Colleen Hoover
books.description: An author hoping to get her career back on track has a relationship with a detective that goes from inspirational to confrontational.
books.title: WOMAN DOWN

books.author: Jennette McCurdy
books.description: A 17-year-old named Waldo has an inexplicable attraction to her creative writing teacher.
books.title: HALF HIS AGE

books.author: Rachel Reid
books.description: The sixth book in the Game Changers series. Ten years into their relationship, Ilya is tired of Shane keeping it a secret.
books.title: THE LONG GAME

books.author: Andy Weir
books.description: Ryland Grace awakes from a long sleep alone and far from home, and the fate of humanity rests on his shoulders.
books.title: PROJECT HAIL MARY

books.author: Rachel Reid
books.description: The captain of a hockey team worries about public perceptions after he starts a relationship with a guy who works at a smoothie shop.
books.title: GAME CHANGER

books.author: Alice Feeney
books.description: In an old house in a seaside town, things may not be what they appear to be.
books.title: MY HUSBAND'S WIFE

books.author: Matt Dinniman
books.description: A Coast Guard vet named Carl and his ex-girlfriend’s cat, Princess Donut, are trapped in a fantasy dungeon.
books.title: DUNGEON CRAWLER CARL

books.author: John Grisham
books.description: When Simon Latch, a lawyer in rural Virginia, is accused of murder, he goes in search of the real killer.
books.title: THE WIDOW

books.author: Peter Schweizer
books.description: The author of “Blood Money” puts forward his argument that mass migration is a political weapon.
books.title: THE INVISIBLE COUP

books.author: Belle Burden
books.description: Burden retraces her marriage of 20 years in search of clues to help shape her understanding about its demise and to find a way forward.
books.title: STRANGERS

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Josh Shapiro with Emily Jane Fox
books.contributor: by Josh Shapiro with Emily Jane Fox
books.description: The governor of Pennsylvania chronicles events that shaped his life and his political career.
books.title: WHERE WE KEEP THE LIGHT

books.author: Andrew Ross Sorkin
books.description: The New York Times journalist and CNBC host looks at the fight between Washington and Wall Street that fueled a historic crash of the stock market.

books.author: John Kennedy
books.description: The Republican senator from Louisiana shares stories about politics in Washington, D.C., and in his home state.
books.title: HOW TO TEST NEGATIVE FOR STUPID

books.author: Jonathan Haidt
books.description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.
books.title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION

books.author: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
books.description: The late activist and advocate for sex-trafficking survivors describes her time with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
books.title: NOBODY'S GIRL

books.author: Spencer Pratt
books.description: The reality TV star recounts setbacks he faced and how his life changed after the Palisades wildfires in 2025.
books.title: THE GUY YOU LOVED TO HATE

books.author: Timothy Snyder
books.description: Twenty lessons from the 20th century about the course of tyranny.
books.title: ON TYRANNY

books.author: Jennette McCurdy
books.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother.
books.title: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED

books.author: Omar El Akkad
books.description: In his nonfiction debut, El Akkad looks at how the West responds to mass suffering.
books.title: ONE DAY, EVERYONE WILL HAVE ALWAYS BEEN AGAINST THIS

books.author: Michael Harriot
books.description: A columnist at TheGrio.com articulates moments in American history that center the perspectives and experiences of Black Americans.
